page.title: 10SARAH VISTS R.N.HASLAR
page.content: My visit to the Children's Ward was arranged by Mrs Deacon,our headteacher's wife who works as a home tutor to the sick children. We visited the 'galley' where meals were served and met some of the children in their 'cabins'(or wards). The most common injuries were those sustained to the head. The children have lots of toys and a special playroom as well as their own T.V. They have a routine and their day starts at around 6am. The children can choose what they would like to eat from a wide menu.Bedtime is around 7pm. I thought the caps that the nurses wore very strange - they have 7 pleats for the 7 seas! We were lucky to visit the hospital's museum and library and saw some amazing exhibits.
